io.github.kushnirvladyslav

Class EventPublisher

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.kushnirvladyslav.EventPublisher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExecuteEventPublisher, ScheduleEventPublisher, SyncEventPublisher

    public abstract class EventPublisher
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable
    Abstract base class for components that publish events to the event management system. Provides common functionality for event publishing and lifecycle management.

    This class maintains a reference to the singleton EventManager and provides protected methods for subclasses to publish events safely. It also handles basic lifecycle management with status tracking.

    Subclasses must implement the shutdown() method to define their specific cleanup behavior when the publisher is being shut down.

    Since:
    2025-06-11
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Vladyslav Kushnir
    See Also:
    EventManager, Event

    • Method Detail

      • publishEvent

        protected void publishEvent(Event<?> event)
        Publishes an event to the event management system. This method is thread-safe and will validate the publisher's status before publishing.
        Parameters:
        event - the event to publish, must not be null
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the event is null
        IllegalStateException - if this publisher has been shut down

      • getStatus

        public Status getStatus()
        Returns the current operational status of this publisher.
        Returns:
        the current status, never null

      • checkNotShutdown

        protected void checkNotShutdown()
        Checks if this publisher is still operational and not shut down. This method is called automatically by publishEvent(Event) but can also be used by subclasses to validate state before performing operations.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this publisher has been shut down

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Determines whether this publisher is currently running and operational.
        Returns:
        true if the publisher is in RUNNING status, false otherwise

      • isShutdown

        public boolean isShutdown()
        Determines whether this publisher has been shut down.
        Returns:
        true if the publisher is in SHUTDOWN status, false otherwise

      • shutdown

        public abstract void shutdown()
        Shuts down this publisher and releases any resources. After calling this method, the publisher cannot be used for publishing events.

        Subclasses must implement this method to define their specific shutdown behavior, such as cleaning up resources, stopping background threads, etc. Subclasses should call setStatus(Status.SHUTDOWN) when shutdown is complete.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if shutdown fails or if already shut down

      • close

        public void close()
        Automatic resource closure tool.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable

      • setStatus

        protected void setStatus(Status newStatus)
        Sets the status of this publisher and logs the change. This method is protected to allow subclasses to manage their lifecycle.
        Parameters:
        newStatus - the new status to set, must not be null
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if newStatus is null

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this publisher including its class name and status.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of this publisher
